citation.article-title: Reclassification of the polyphyletic genus Prosthecomicrobium to form two novel genera, Vasilyevaea gen. nov. and Bauldia gen. nov. with four new combinations: Vasilyevaea enhydra comb. nov., Vasilyevaea mishustinii comb. nov., Bauldia consociata comb. nov. and Bauldia litoralis comb. nov.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Vasilyevaea (Va.sil′ye.vae.a. N.L. fem. n. Vasilyevaea of Vasilyeva, named in honour of Lina Vasilyeva, a Russian microbiologist who has dedicated her career to the investigation of prosthecate bacteria and has named several new genera within this group).
Gram-negative, budding, prosthecate bacteria with numerous short appendages, less than 1 μm in length, that cover the cell surface.
Use a variety of carbon sources including sugars and sugar alcohols for growth.
Organisms are found in fresh water or soils.
DNA G+C content (mol%) ranges from 63 to 66.
The type species is Vasilyevaea enhydra.
